p:
Sandermann and Dietrichs
44 found a new natural product from Tectona grandis L., tectol ( 4). Tectol showed moderate inhibition against FTase (IC 50 = 2.09 μM)
3 . Cadelis et al.
3 synthesised and analysed the derivatives of tectol. They found, as opposed to tecomaquinone I, the derivative with longer side chain ( 6) has stronger inhibitory activity (IC 50 = 1.8 μM). They believed that tecomaquinone I can be used as a novel scaffold to develop more effective FTIs
3 .
